history.content:
Interested in robotics? Curious about how all the cool robots that you watch on Youtube work? Want to build and/or program your own?


Robotics@Berkeley is launching a themed program: Mobile Robotics! We are actively looking for eager participants to come join in! Prior robotics experience is not required, while previous CS/EE/Controls/MechE experience will be very useful. Our application process is simple and inclusive . 

This program will be focused on designing, building and programming robots that move in creative and innovative ways. Participants will develop projects to explore the present and future of mobility in robotics as well as explore both the software and hardware challenges of autonomous mobility.

Participants will come together and form teams (4-5 members each) to work on a mobile robotics project for the semester and each team will be provided a grant of $250 for purchasing parts and will have access to a community of makers, mentorship and access to club parts. At the end, all teams will present and demo their project in a final presentation to other club members and the UC Berkeley community.

Not sure who to work with? We have two infosessions/team formation mixers: 
** Infosession/Mixer 1 **
Thursday, Jan 31st
8-9 pm, Soda 310
(FB event link: https://www.facebook.com/events/310463026341929/)

** Infosession/Mixer 2 **
Wednesday, Feb 6th
8-9 pm, Soda 310
(FB event link: https://www.facebook.com/events/2239522266269463/)

** Applications Due **
Friday, Feb 8th, 11:59 pm 
Application Link: https://tinyurl.com/roboticsberkeley

Further information can be found on our website: https://rab.berkeley.edu/events/mobilerobotics/

For questions message the club FB page and like the Robotics at Berkeley page (facebook.com/roboticsatberkeley/) for updates.

----------About Us----------

Robotics @ Berkeley is a student organization dedicated to being the hub for students on and around UC Berkeley who are interested in developing robotics projects and learning more. We strive to be an organization in which students can explore their own ideas, become friends with people who hold similar interests, and hone their abilities to design and build complex machines.

In Fall 2018, we organized Dorm Ex Machina 3.0 - a robotic dorm automation competition, started a new General Membership program for people who want to work on a broad range of projects, reached out to the broader community by volunteering in the Bay Area Science Fair, demoed at the Jacobs Hall Homecoming Event and attended a club talk by the CTO of Kiwi (maker of KiwiBots)!
history.subject: Robotics@Berkeley Recruiting and Infosessions
